quote: Station log, Stardate 47182.1.  DS-   Nine has been temporarily evacuated    due to a violent plasma disruption    in the Denorios Belt.  Until the    disturbance ends, we'll be forced to    maintain the station with a skeleton    crew.
How are we holding up?
So far, so good.  I'll say one thing    for the Cardassians, they built this    place to last.
And just in case it doesn't, I've    got the Orinoco prepped and ready at    Pad "C."
Any word from Chief O'Brien?
He and Odo checked in about an hour    ago.  They sealed off the airlocks    in the upper and lower pylons and    were moving on to the docking ring.
Sisko to O'Brien.
O'Brien here.
What's your status, Chief?

Almost done, Commander.  We've sealed    all the airlocks on Levels Twenty-   One, Twenty-Two and Twenty-Three,    but we still have to check the outer    bulkheads to make sure there hasn't    been any crystallization from the    plasma discharges... Shouldn't take    much longer.
I thought you might like to know...    we received a message from Bajor    just before the plasma storm cut off    communications.  The shuttle with    your family aboard arrived safely.
Yes, sir.  Thank you.  O'Brien    out.
Did you hear that?
Hear what?
I could've sworn I heard something.
Quark.
What are you doing here?  You're    under strict orders from Sisko not    to leave the bar.
I'm not a prisoner, Odo.  I    volunteered to stay and help you    protect the station.

The only reason you "volunteered"    was because there wasn't any room on    the evacuation shuttles for six    hundred bars of gold-pressed latinum.       Which still doesn't explain what    you're doing out here in the docking    ring.
I was saying good-bye to my brother.
Your brother?  His shuttle left three    hours ago.
Funny, it's only been three hours...    and I'm already lost without him...
Oh, please.  Don't try to tell me    you've been sitting here all this    time pining for Rom.
I know, I know.  He couldn't find a    cup of water if you dropped him in a    lake... but even if he is an idiot,    he's still my brother...
And you'd betray him in a second if    it suited your interests.
But that doesn't mean I don't love    him...       Chief, do you have any brothers?
(not sure what Quark     is getting at)   As a matter of fact, I have two...
And did you ever have to say    good-bye to them?
Sure, when I joined Starfleet...
And did it bring a tear to your eye?
I suppose it did.
(triumphant, gestures     to Odo)   Well try explaining that to him.
The storm's intensity is up thirty-   seven percent.
Is there any way to tell how long    it'll last?
Your guess is as good as mine.  Plasma    storms are extremely rare.       But look on the bright side, this    gives us a great opportunity to study    one.
Lucky us.
You should see the view from the    Promenade.  Simply amazing.
I assume the Promenade is secure.
Yes sir.  I've struck the sails and    battened the hatches... so to speak.
Benjamin...       You'd better look at this.
I'm detecting a small vessel headed    this way at one quarter impulse.
They're hailing us.
On screen.
I can't get a visual.

... cargo ship Ekina.  We've been    caught by the storm.  Our engines    have been severely damaged.  We need    emergency assistance.  Can you read    me?  Repeat, this is the cargo ship    Ekina...
I've lost it.
Can you get a transporter lock on    the crew?
There's too much interference.
Engage the tractor beam.  Bring them    into the closest docking bay.
It's not working.  The plasma storm    is dispersing the beam.
Maybe if we modulate the frequency    of the beam...
I've got them.  But I don't know how    long I can hold on.
Bring them into docking bay five.
There might be casualties.  I'll get    down to the Infirmary.
(nods to Bashir; to     com)   Sisko to O'Brien.
O'Brien here.
We've got some storm victims coming    into docking bay five.  They may be    in need of assistance.
I'll have to release the emergency    seals on the airlock before they can    board the station.       On my way.
Stand clear.
Are you all right?  Is anyone hurt?
Not yet.
What the hell do you think you're    doing?
(gestures toward the     airlock door)   No questions.  Into the corridor.
This is a fine way of showing your    gratitude.  We just saved your lives    out there.
You see?  The ever-helpful Federation.     So predictable.
Listen here, friend... in case you
The Empire is governed by doddering    fools and frightened old women who    aren't worthy of the name Klingon.       Mareel, the combadges.
This one must be the shape-shifter.
Go on, what are you waiting for?
You're a Trill.
Inside.
And what if I refuse?
Please.  Do as he says and no one    will get hurt.
Now, shifter.       Or this one dies.
Let's go...       Ally.
Were there any casualties?
That depends on you.
Yeto, get the Ferengi.
You mind telling me what this is all    about?
Any more questions?
Don't hurt him.
Mareel, the box.
Put it in your stasis chamber.
Now.  Or I will destroy it.
Is that supposed to be some kind of    threat?
They've got Odo in there.
I see... In that case...
I'm still not getting a response    from O'Brien or Odo.
Run a level three security scan.
Don't bother.
Please... take your hands away from    the controls.
Now.    (gestures with his     disruptor)   To the center of the room.
Do as he says.
Don't worry, Verad.  Everything's    going to be all right.
Get with the others.
Your turn, little man.
Don't forget to disable the backups    as well as the primary systems.
It's my fault, Commander.  They took    us by surprise.  Somehow, they must    have neutralized the security systems    in the docking ring.
And how did they manage that?
I'm not sure.       But I've got a pretty good idea.  We    ran across Quark in an airlock a    little while ago.
When this is over, Quark and I are    going to have a little "talk."
Do you know him?
Ah, Yeto... It's such a pleasure    doing business with Klingons.  You're    so... punctual.
I see that your ship was "rescued"    according to plan.  I've got your    merchandise right here... but I don't    see any latinum.
(shakes his head in     disgust)   You Ferengi... you think you're so    clever... but you're stupid.
Now, now.  There's no need for name    calling.  If you don't want these    liquid data chains, I'm sure I can    line up dozens of other buyers.
Go right ahead.
Yeto... this is no time to haggle    for a better deal.  Where else are    you going to get data chains of this    quality for such a reasonable price?
You can keep your data chains...
Don't be ridiculous... You expect me    to believe you've come all this way,    braved the storm, just to tell me    the deal is off?
Stupid Ferengi.
I said no one moves.
I'm the commander of this station.     What's your business here?
You'll have to ask my employer.
I... I'm sorry about this.  If    everyone would just cooperate, I    promise this will all be over soon.
What will be over soon?
This is an outrage.  I demand that    you release me at once.
Enough of your whining.
Who are these people?  What do they    want with us?
Funny, I was just about to ask you    that.
That's enough.
I agree.  Now tell me what you want    here.
Dax.       I want Dax.
She's not going anywhere with you.
No, no.  I... I don't want the girl.     I only want what is rightfully mine...    what should have been mine years    ago.  I want Dax.
The symbiont, Benjamin.  He's come    to steal my symbiont.
You can't remove Jadzia's symbiont.     If you do, she'll die.
He knows that, Doctor.
I'm sorry.  Please believe me, I    wish I didn't have to do this.
Then don't.

I don't have any choice.  I spent my    whole life trying to qualify for the    joining.  I studied constantly...    every day... every waking hour...       I sacrificed everything... And then    I went before the Symbiosis Evaluation    Board... and they reduced my entire    life to one word... "Unsuitable... "
That's nothing to be ashamed of.     Neither of my parents or my sister    underwent symbiosis.  And they lead    happy and productive lives.  Only    one Trill in ten is chosen to be    joined.
That's easy for you to say.  They    chose you.
I was one of the lucky ones.
And now it's Verad's turn to be lucky.
But why Dax?  There are thousands of    symbionts on Trill.  Why her?
I did research... I worked it all    out... The Dax symbiont is the best    match for me.  We have mutual    interests in science... diplomacy...
There's another reason, isn't there?
The wormhole.       Once you've stolen the symbiont, you    plan on escaping into the Gamma    Quadrant, don't you?
Can you think of a better place to    start a new life?

I understand your frustration... But    there could be dozens of reasons why    the Board didn't select you for    symbiosis.  They have to be very    careful.  An improper joining can    cause permanent psychological    damage... to both the symbiont and    the host.  They were just looking    after your best interests.

Your best interests, maybe... but    not mine.  All they've done is condemn    me to a life of mediocrity... Well,    I refuse to accept it.  I won't spend    the rest of my life dreaming about    what I could have been... what I    should have been.  I deserve more.     And I'm going to get it.
Yeto, T'Kar.  It's time.
I'll have no part in this.
I... I understand.
Keep away from him.
There.  You see?  I've taken the    first step.  Even if I don't get    what I want, my life is over.  So    either you help me... or you and    your friends will die.  It's your    choice.
He'll help.       I don't want anyone else hurt because    of me.       But you have to give me your word    that no one else on the station will    be harmed.
I promise.       Doctor.
Do as he says, Julian.  Please.
Let me treat Chief O'Brien's phaser    wound first.    (sees Verad's     reluctance)   It won't take long.
There's an emergency medical kit    under that console.
Hold still.
There.  There should be no permanent    damage.
Apply this every twenty minutes or    so.  It'll help the wound regenerate.
Enough stalling.       Take them to the Infirmary.
Do as he says, Doctor.  This is no    time to be a hero.
This isn't over, Dax.  I promise you    that.
Dax...

(anticipating what     he's going to say)   I know, Benjamin... you'll do all    you can.  But just in case it isn't    enough, I want you to know...    (beat, searches for     the words, smiles)   It's been fun.
Good luck.
It won't be long now.  And then you'll    see.  Everything will be just as I    promised.
I know.
What's that?
It's a delta wave inducer.  It will    keep you asleep through the surgery.     It also increases your body's natural    endorphin production to help    accelerate the healing process.
I don't want it.
I strongly advise that you use it...    the surgery will be much easier on    you if you...

I don't need your advice.  I want to    be awake.  Use a neuro-electrical    suppressor.  And set up a monitor so    I can watch the procedure.  That    way, if you run into any "trouble,"    I'll be able to assist you.       Now let's get started.
And if I refuse.
Verad to Mareel.
Is there a problem?
That's up to the doctor.       Will you cooperate?  Or do I tell    Mareel to shoot the hostages?  Who    should she start with... The    Bajoran... or maybe your commander...
No.  That won't be necessary.
Good.  No more games.  If I don't    survive this, neither will they.       Did you hear that, Mareel?
I heard.  Mareel out.
Now, Doctor...
I'm sorry, Jadzia.
Don't blame yourself, Julian.  You    did all you could.
I...       This will help you sleep.
Thank you.
Forgive me...
How long can Jadzia survive without    the symbiont?
Once the symbiont's removed, the    host usually dies within hours.  But    Jadzia's young and healthy... Bashir    will do all he can...       She'll make it through the night.
That still doesn't give us much    time...
No talking.
I don't want to kill you, Commander...    but I will.
You had your chance.
This is ridiculous.  Don't you realize    they're going to kill us?  What are    you people sitting around for?  Do    something.
Do you have any suggestions?
Why should I have any suggestions?     I'm not the military mastermind.     I'm just a victim of circumstances.
A victim?  Really?  Then maybe you'd    like to tell me how four armed    terrorists got past the docking ring    security grid.
Security grid?  I don't know what    you're talking...
Save it, Quark.  You've crossed the    line this time.
You sold us out, and Dax may die    because of it.  Whatever happens    next, one thing's certain... You're    through here.
Are you all right?
I'll live.
Don't try that again.  I don't want    to have to hurt anyone.
Tell that to Jadzia.
That's different.
Do you really believe that?
You heard Verad.  They didn't leave    him any other choice.
That's his reason.  What's yours?
I owe him.  I grew up on the streets    of Khefka Four.  I never would've    made it out of there without Verad.
What was he doing on Khefka Four?

He was the communications clerk for    the Federation consulate.  He used    to come by the accommodation house    where I worked.  I'd help him relax.     When he got recalled to Trill, he    asked me to go with him... we've    been together ever since.
So that's it... He got you out of a    bad situation and now you're willing    to kill for him?
He's an unhappy man.  And if there's    anything I can do to make him happy,    I'll do it.
Even if it means losing him?
Losing him?
After the surgery, Verad won't be    just Verad anymore... He'll be a    blending of Verad, Dax, and all the    previous hosts.  Their memories,    their knowledge... even their    personalities.
Verad told me you'd say things like    that.       I know he'll change... he'll be    smarter, more confident... but in    all the important ways, he'll be the    same.
I'm sorry, but if he told you that,    he's lying.  When a Trill is joined,    it's like a rebirth.  He'll be an    entirely different person.
If you think I'm going to betray    Verad, you're wrong.  It doesn't    matter what you say.  I love him...    and I'm going to stand by him... no    matter what.
I never doubted it.
Verad.
No.  Not just Verad.       I'm Verad Dax.
(to Yeto, indicating     the device)   Take this.
Come on, we haven't got much time.     Just move it back and forth over the    wound in slow even strokes.
Why bother?  She'll be dead in a few    hours anyway.
Not if I have anything to do with    it.  Now help me.
Why should I?  She let herself be    slaughtered like a mindless t'gla.     If she wanted to live, she should    have fought back.
She did what she did to save the    rest of us.
Then she's a fool and deserves her    fate.

Now listen here, Yeto, or whatever    your name is... I don't care about    your warrior ethic, or your Klingon    philosophy.  This woman's dying and    you're going to help me save her.     Now take the instrument.
So the little human's got some spark    after all.
I said smooth, even strokes.
(waiting for the hypo     to take effect)   Come on... come on...
Julian...
Thank God, I thought I'd lost you.
The symbiont... it's gone...
Everything went perfectly.  The    operation was a complete success...
I feel so... alone...
(trying to keep both     their spirits up)   I... I've got you stabilized.  If we    can just get the symbiont back in    time...
Julian... I'm scared.
You're not going to die.  Do you    hear me?  I won't let you die.
I've never felt... so empty...
Dax?
(with his newfound     strength)   That's right, Benjamin... It's me...
Curzon, Tobin, Jadzia... all the    others... they're part of you now.
It's amazing.  So many ideas... so    many memories...
Eight lifetimes of memories.  It    must be incredible.
(looking Sisko in the     eye)   It's better than I ever imagined.
This station must look entirely    different to you.
It does.  I...       I know this place.    (looks at Sisko and     smiles)   And I know you... Benjamin.
Of course you do.  Remember when we    first met...
Pelios Station.
Anastasia?
(playing top-that-    memory)   And that trip we took to the cliffs    of Bole.
And all the months we served aboard    the Livingston?
Science officer Kustanovich.  What    was it... eight helpings of Andorian    Redbat?
I've never seen anybody eat like    that.       Remember my wedding?
I remember your bachelor party.     Some of it, anyway.
And the time we discovered the    wormhole?
One of Jadzia's proudest moments.
And now that woman is bleeding to    death in the Infirmary.
I'd rather not discuss that, Benjamin.
You have to discuss it, Dax.  You    know as well as I do that we can't    let her die.
But she's not going to die.  She'll    live on, in me.
Jadzia's memories will live on.  But    Jadzia herself will die.  You'll    have killed her.

You think I don't know that.  I'll    never be able to forget it.       But I promise you, Benjamin... I'll    do all I can to make up for it.  I'm    not going to the Gamma Quadrant to    hide.  There're entire worlds which    can benefit from my knowledge and    experience.  I can help them... and    I will.
I've got a better idea.       Help Jadzia.  Come down to the    Infirmary with me.  Put the symbiont    back where it belongs.
I can't do that, Benjamin... even if    I wanted to.  Don't you see... it's    too late.  The integration is already    under way.
But there's still time to stop it.     Jadzia's life can still be saved.
Don't listen to him.  He's just trying    to confuse you.
It's all right, Mareel.       Benjamin, the symbiont's still weak    from the operation.  If we attempt    another joining so soon, it might    not survive.  Are you willing to    risk that?
I am.  The question is... are you?
Why are you wasting your time with    him?
Because he's my friend.  Now go watch    the others.
(ignoring her, to     Sisko)   We are still friends, aren't we    Benjamin?
I hope so.  Come down to the Infirmary    with me and prove it.
I can't do that.
Then you're not the Dax I know.  And    our friendship's over.
Here, drink this.
What is it?
Senarian Egg Broth.  It'll keep your    strength up.
All right, don't drink it.  It makes    no difference to me.
Hold on.
Not bad.  Thanks.
He even looks different, doesn't he?       The way he stands, the way he moves...    talks...
He's better than he was.
I'm glad you think so.
I do.
Really?  The way he dismissed you    before... I'm sure Verad never did    that.
He's under a lot of stress.
Verad was under stress from the minute    he stepped onto this station.  But    he never turned on you... did he?
What's your point, Commander?
I think you know.
You're trying to turn me against    Verad.
Verad no longer exists.  You know    that better than I do.
All right then, Verad Dax.  But    it won't work.       Nothing's changed between us.
You really believe that?
Yes.
Then make me believe it.       Go in there and talk to him.
Talk to him... About what?
I don't know... whatever you want.     You must have a lot to say to one    another.
I don't want to disturb him.
Why not?
Because I don't want to.
But look at him... sitting there...    all alone.  He needs you.
That's enough.
Why are you being so reluctant?     This is a perfect time for the two    of you to get reaquainted.
I said... that's enough.
Mareel.
Is anything wrong?
Well?
No.  Everything's fine.
Good.       Be careful.  I wouldn't want anything    to happen to you.
I got him.
Stay back.
Maybe we should talk about this?
My ear...
Pathetic.
Mareel... take him to the Infirmary.
(his mind's still on     Dax)   What is it now?
Please, it hurts...
All right.  Just hold on.
The damage appears to be fairly    superficial.
Ferengi ears are incredibly sensitive.     I'd better run some further tests.
The storm's intensity's dropped
Good.  I'm tired of waiting here.
How're you feeling?

Better than ever... thanks to you.       I couldn't have done this without    you.  I would've spent the rest of    my life a mediocre man... only    dreaming of what might've been.       You know what you have to do.
You just worry about getting through    the wormhole.  The Klingons and I'll    make sure that no one stops you.
Remember, I don't want you staying    here any longer than you have to.     Give me an hour, then head for the    wormhole.  The runabout's on Pad "C."
The sooner you leave, the sooner I    can follow.  And the sooner we can    be together.
It's going to be all right, isn't    it?
(with a reassuring     smile)   Just wait for me at the rendezvous    point.
Stop whining or I'll put you out of    your misery.
It's not his fault.  He's got a deep    contusion of the auricular lobe and    a possible dislocated malleus.  In a    Ferengi, either condition can be    fatal.
(holds out a medical     tool)   If you want him to stop, then give    me a hand with this.
I'm not your nurse.
Look, let's not go through that again.     Just hold this against his ear...
Not too hard.
Just another second... There.
Thank you, Doctor.  I feel better    already.
How is she?
I've got her stabilized.  But there's    no telling how much time she's got    left.  We have to get the symbiont    back before it's too late.
What are you doing?
Odo's in here.
He is.
Yes, and we have to get him out.
Are you sure?
Quark.
If we only knew the access code...
Allow me.
Hmmm, your standard Delgorian locking    mechanism.  Sophisticated but    vulnerable if you know its weak    points.       Hand me that laser scalpel.
It's a gift.
The storm's decreased another fifteen    percent.
Excellent.  That should be more than    enough to allow safe passage to the    wormhole.
Verad to Yeto.
Verad to Yeto.
Yeto, report.
The doctor must have overpowered    him.
The doctor?  Impossible.       Unless...
The shape-shifter.  He must've freed    the shape-shifter.       T'Kar, get me to the ship.
You better take a hostage, just in    case.
I'll go with you.
I'd love your company, Benjamin.     But somehow I don't think you have    my best interests at heart.       Kira, I hate to inconvenience you,    but...
Mareel...
Good luck.
Well, Benjamin, I guess this is    good-bye.  Not many friendships last    over two lifetimes.    (beat, there's some     honest regret here)   I wish we could have made it three.
You'll be seeing me again, Verad.
So where's this rendezvous going to    be?
You don't really expect me to tell    you?
No, but I hope you like it there,    because you'll be waiting for Verad    a long time.
How would you know?
You told me yourself.    (a beat, off her     reaction)   I saw the look on your face when he    asked you to wait for him...
The plan was that he was going to    get there first... That he would    wait for me... not the other    way around.
(playing devil's     advocate)   I suppose it could've been an honest    mistake... a slip of the tongue...
No.  He lied to me.       He's never lied to me before.  He's    not coming.  He doesn't need me    anymore.
You're wrong.  He does need you...    now more than ever.
(knows what he's     getting at)   You never give up, do you.  I told    you, I'm not going to betray him.
I'm not asking you to.  I'm asking    you to save him... to help us save    him.
All you care about is Jadzia.
That's right.  And you care about    Verad.  And we can save them both.
Don't you see, Dax and Verad were    never meant to be joined.  We've got    to remove the symbiont while there's    still time.
If you hurt him, I'll kill you.
I don't doubt it.
The ship... it's gone.
That's because I released the docking    clamps.
Looks like that "goodbye" was a little    premature.
Don't be ridiculous.  You're not    going to shoot me.
What makes you so sure?
This is Dax you're talking to,    Benjamin.  We both know that if you    shoot me, even on stun, you risk    killing the symbiont.
If I let you go, Jadzia dies.
But Dax will live.  What's one girl's    life, compared to eight lifetimes of    knowledge and experience?
You're not going to shoot me.  You    know that... and so do I.
Goodbye, Benjamin.
Verad...
Don't call me Benjamin.
I feel strange.  So...    (realizes what has     happened)   Empty.
It's over Verad.  The symbiont is    back where it belongs.
So close.  I had it.  I had it and    now... I'm alone...
You're not alone, Verad.  I'm here.     I'll always be here.
I can't remember any of it... the    knowledge... the confidence...       It's all gone.
Commander?
Jadzia.
Are you...
I'm fine...
I remember it all, Benjamin.     Everything he thought... everything    he did... and it's so... sad.       I guess he'll always be with me now...
